SEARCH
Package model

Class Project

java.lang.Object
model.Project
public class Project extends Object
The Project class represents a project with its attributes, including the project name, start date, end date, budget, client manager, manager, and stages.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    SIZE_STAGES
    The number of stages in a project.

  • Field Details

    • SIZE_STAGES

      public static final int SIZE_STAGES
      The number of stages in a project. A project has 6 stages: 1. Initiation 2. Analysis 3. Execution 4. Closure 5. Monitoring 6. Control.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Project

      public Project(String projectName, Calendar startDate, Calendar endDate, double budget, String clientManagerName, String clientManagerPhone, String managerName, String managerCellPhone, int[] monthsStage)
      Constructs a Project object with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      projectName - the name of the project.
      startDate - the start date of the project.
      endDate - the end date of the project.
      budget - the budget of the project.
      clientManagerName - the name of the client manager of the project.
      clientManagerPhone - the phone number of the client manager of the project.
      managerName - the name of the manager of the project.
      managerCellPhone - the phone number of the manager of the project.
      monthsStage - an array of months for each stage of the project.

  • Method Details

    • addManagers

      public void addManagers(String clientManagerName, String clientManagerPhone, String managerName, String managerCellPhone)

      clientManagerName - the name of the client manager of the project.
      clientManagerPhone - the phone number of the client manager of the project.
      managerName - the name of the manager of the project.
      managerCellPhone - the phone number of the manager of the project.

      Parameters:
      situationDescription - a description of the situation
      capsuleType - the type of capsule
      authorName - the name of the author
      authorPosition - the position of the author
      lessonLearned - a lesson learned from the situation
